intro: Inula subscaposa, commonly known as the slender elecampane, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flower heads consist of numerous small florets, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. Inula subscaposa is often found in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
